revised_title: Inoculation of Smallpox in New England: Treatment and Recovery
tldr: This article describes the process of inoculating smallpox in New England and the subsequent treatment and recovery. The author, Henry Newman, explains the method of making incisions and applying variolous matter, as well as the management of symptoms during the recovery process. The article also highlights the success of this method in treating various health conditions, including women in childbed and those with long-running ulcers.
